ru.jango.j0widget.camera

Class BitmapProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.jango.j0widget.camera.BitmapProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class BitmapProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Helper class for asynchronous processing images. In constructor should be passed image as byte array, BitmapProcessor.BitmapProcessorListener for receiving result and a URI to identify result after processing.

    Capabilities:

    • resize by setPictureSize(android.graphics.Point)
    • rotate by setPictureRotation(int)
    • create thumbnails sized by setThumbnailSize(android.graphics.Point)

      • postProcessingFinished

        protected void postProcessingFinished(byte[] pic,
                          android.graphics.Bitmap thumbnail)
        Invokes listener, that bitmap was processed successfully, if the listener was previously set. Method will be called on main thread.
        Parameters:
        pic - processed bitmap as byte array
        thumbnail - the same bitmap, but resized to getThumbnailSize()

      • postProcessingFailed

        protected void postProcessingFailed(java.lang.Exception e)
        Invokes listener, that bitmap processing failed, if the listener was previously set. Method will be called on main thread.
        Parameters:
        e - fail reason

      • decodeData

        protected android.graphics.Bitmap decodeData()
        Smart picture decoding - checks specified picture size and max Android texture size (2048x2048).

      • preparePicture

        protected byte[] preparePicture()
        Actually processes picture. Checks max texture size (2048x2048 in Android), scales data if needed and rotates it if needed.

      • prepareThumbnail

        protected android.graphics.Bitmap prepareThumbnail(byte[] preparedPicture)
        Actually processes thumbnail. Checks specified thumbnail size and does scaling, or returns NULL.

      • doInBackground

        protected void doInBackground()
        If you want to add more processing features (except scaling and rotating), you could subclass BitmapProcessor and rewrite this method. Actual bitmap processing work is done here.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
